intro: Eurya chinensis subsp. chinensis, commonly known as Chinese holly, is a species of evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in gardens and landscapes.
